  • Database Models

Database Models#

Database Models Module

This module defines the ORM models for the application using SQLAlchemy. It includes models for application configuration, users, event slots, and bookings.

class Base(**kwargs: Any)[source]#

Bases: DeclarativeBase

Base class for declarative SQLAlchemy models.

A simple constructor that allows initialization from kwargs.

Sets attributes on the constructed instance using the names and values in kwargs.

Only keys that are present as attributes of the instance’s class are allowed. These could be, for example, any mapped columns or relationships.

registry: ClassVar[_RegistryType] = <sqlalchemy.orm.decl_api.registry object>#

Refers to the _orm.registry in use where new _orm.Mapper objects will be associated.

class Configuration(**kwargs)[source]#

Bases: Base

Configuration settings for the application.

Stores global settings that influence system behavior, such as location, timezone, weather sensitivity, and default operational hours.

id#

Primary key.

Type:

int

latitude#

Geographic latitude (-90 to 90).

Type:

float

longitude#

Geographic longitude (-180 to 180).

Type:

float

timezone#

IANA timezone string.

Type:

str

weather_threshold#

Minimum acceptable weather rating (0-100).

Type:

int

max_bookings_per_event#

Default maximum bookings allowed per slot.

Type:

int

default_opening_time#

Default slot start time (local time).

Type:

time

default_closing_time#

Default slot end time (local time).

Type:

time

A simple constructor that allows initialization from kwargs.

Sets attributes on the constructed instance using the names and values in kwargs.

Only keys that are present as attributes of the instance’s class are allowed. These could be, for example, any mapped columns or relationships.

static get_config(session: Session) → Configuration[source]#

Retrieve the current configuration from the database.

If none exists, a default configuration is created and persisted.

Parameters:

session (Session) – SQLAlchemy session instance.

Returns:

The configuration object.

Return type:

Configuration

class User(name, email, password, role='User', admin_rank=None)[source]#

Bases: Base

User model representing a system user.

Stores encrypted user data and securely hashed passwords. Provides methods for setting/verifying passwords and handling encrypted fields.

id#

Primary key.

Type:

int

name_encrypted#

AES-encrypted user name.

Type:

str

email_encrypted#

AES-encrypted email address.

Type:

str

password_hash#

Bcrypt-hashed password.

Type:

str

role#

Role (User/Admin), default is ‘User’.

Type:

str

blocked#

True if user is blocked.

Type:

bool

admin_rank#

Admin rank if applicable (e.g., ‘super’).

Type:

Optional[str]

bookings#

One-to-many relationship with Booking.

Type:

relationship

Initialize a new user instance with encrypted fields and a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Plaintext name.

  • email (str) – Plaintext email address.

  • password (str) – Plaintext password.

  • role (str) – Role (default is ‘User’).

set_password(password)[source]#

Hash and securely store the user’s password.

verify_password(password)[source]#

Check if the provided password matches the stored hash.

set_email(email)[source]#

Encrypt and store the user’s email.

get_email()[source]#

Decrypt and return the user’s email.

set_name(name)[source]#

Encrypt and store the user’s name.

get_name()[source]#

Decrypt and return the user’s name.

class Slot(**kwargs)[source]#

Bases: Base

Slot model representing an event slot available for booking.

id#

Primary key.

Type:

int

title#

Short title for the slot.

Type:

str

description#

Description or purpose of the slot.

Type:

str

start_time#

Slot start time (UTC).

Type:

datetime

end_time#

Slot end time (UTC).

Type:

datetime

available#

True if the slot is available.

Type:

bool

weather_rating#

Weather suitability rating (0-100).

Type:

Optional[float]

max_bookings#

Max bookings allowed for this slot.

Type:

int

weather_warning#

True if weather is unfavorable.

Type:

bool

weather_forecast#

True if forecast data is present.

Type:

bool

bookings#

One-to-many relationship with Booking.

Type:

relationship

A simple constructor that allows initialization from kwargs.

Sets attributes on the constructed instance using the names and values in kwargs.

Only keys that are present as attributes of the instance’s class are allowed. These could be, for example, any mapped columns or relationships.

class Booking(**kwargs)[source]#

Bases: Base

Booking model representing a user booking for a slot.

id#

Primary key.

Type:

int

user_id#

Foreign key to User.

Type:

int

slot_id#

Foreign key to Slot.

Type:

int

status#

Booking status (e.g., ‘confirmed’).

Type:

str

user#

Many-to-one link to User.

Type:

relationship

slot#

Many-to-one link to Slot.

Type:

relationship

A simple constructor that allows initialization from kwargs.

Sets attributes on the constructed instance using the names and values in kwargs.

Only keys that are present as attributes of the instance’s class are allowed. These could be, for example, any mapped columns or relationships.
